title: What you missed at our record-breaking GenAI Intensive course

html:
May 09, 2025

[[read-time]] min read

AI enthusiasts learned from Google experts to gain the latest skills.

Anant Nawalgaria

Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer and Founder, GenAI intensive

Bullet points

  • Google and Kaggle's Gen AI Intensive course smashed attendance records!
  • It covered foundational models, prompt engineering, embeddings, and more.
  • Hands-on labs used tools like Gemini API and Vertex AI.
  • A strong community fostered learning through Discord and live sessions.
  • Missed the live event? Catch up with the self-paced Kaggle Learn Guide.

Summaries were generated by Google AI. Generative AI is experimental.

Basic explainer

Google and Kaggle taught a huge online class about AI. Over 280,000 people signed up! It covered AI basics to using it in real projects. You can still learn from it online.

Summaries were generated by Google AI. Generative AI is experimental.

Explore other styles:

Google and Kaggle’s recent Gen AI Intensive course, back for its second year, had more than 280,000 signups in just 20 days — and the attendance broke the GUINNESS WORLD RECORDS™ title for the Largest Attendance at a Virtual AI Conference in One Week. In case you missed it, here’s what we covered, and how you can learn more.

The content

We thoughtfully designed the course to give participants a strong understanding of generative AI, from the basics of large language models (LLMs) to actually using gen AI with tools in production. The live course was carefully architected to deliver a balanced mix of theory, hands-on learning and community engagement across five intensive days. Each day focused on a specific topic and included a variety of resources to deepen understanding and provide practical experience:

  • Day 1: Foundational Models & Prompt Engineering - Podcast (1&2), Livestream
  • Day 2: Embeddings and Vector Stores/Databases - Podcast, Livestream
  • Day 3: Generative AI Agents - Podcast, Livestream
  • Day 4: Domain-Specific LLMs - Podcast, Livestream
  • Day 5: MLOps for Generative AI - Podcast, Livestream

The assignments

Assignments included AI-generated podcasts (created using NotebookLM) and informative whitepapers (written by experts across Google). For hands-on learning, participants engaged with practical code labs on Kaggle where they could experiment with different gen AI techniques and tools, like the Gemini API, Embeddings, Vertex AI, and open source tools like LangGraph. We also added a capstone project at the end of the course for participants to get even more hands-on practice implementing concepts they’ve learned. Check out the winning submissions here.

The community

Community interaction was facilitated through a Discord chat, actively moderated by Googlers, and via livestream sessions featuring expert guests from Google who answered questions and delved deeper into thematic topics, allowing participants to connect directly with course creators and experts.

If you missed the live course, some of the most popular gen AI Intensive content has been adapted into a self-paced format and is available as a Kaggle Learn Guide.
